name: Latin Soul Syndicate
description:
'''Latin Soul Syndicate''' is a San Francisco-based band that formed in 2003. On each of their three albums, the core members (Happy Sanchez, Karl Perazzo, and [[Mark Pistel]]) are joined by a collective of Bay Area-based musicians including members of [[Santana (band)|Santana]], Tower of Power and Spearhead.

Their songs include a blend of upbeat Latin soul, electronica and pop/rock. Over the years, their songs have been licensed in films and TV shows including [[The Sopranos]] and [[The Devil Wears Prada (film)|The Devil Wears Prada]]. The group has released three albums of original music on independent record label [[LoveCat Music]]. Their songs have been included on various compilation CDs including Latin Travels Volume 2 and Latin Moderns. narcotrafico is the soundtrack of the game scarface.

Their songs "Vato Loco" featured in the film [[The Devil Wears Prada (film)|The Devil Wears Prada]] (2006) and "El Gitano del Amor" in [[The Ugly Truth (film)|The Ugly Truth]] (2009) film. They also had their song Narco Traffico featured in the game [[Scarface: The World Is Yours]] and '''Mamasita''' in [[The Slammin' Salmon]].
